intro: Ilex serrata var. xanthocarpa, commonly known as the yellow-fruited holly, is a variant of the holly genus native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with serrated edges and produces small, bright yellow berries that are a striking feature of the plant. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters in suitable conditions. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The berries are not only visually appealing but also serve as a food source for various bird species.
